intro: Tephrosia uniflora subsp. uniflora, commonly known as the narrowleaf tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. It is characterized by its woody stems and is often found in dry, open habitats. The species is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
